intro: Castilleja albobarbata, commonly known as the white-tipped grass-of-Popov, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. The plant has slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Castilleja albobarbata relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it an important component of ecological interactions in its native range.
